Upon re-unzipping this file, I removed my Anti Virus that I could see if the game worked, and voilà, it works! =D
I set the graphics to the highest (because my Mac can stand it) and it still runs smoothly =)

For the people who don't mind having a Virus in their mac, this works very good. But if you are against viruses, then well, find another game to play =P

I seem to be having the same problem that naffbilly and lahnik had, where it appears in the dock, stays for a minute, and then goes away. the only difference is that I do have the deadspace3.exe file on mine, and it still won't start. any suggestions?

Sorry for posting late. You wouldn't believe if I said I couldn't create a piratebay account before switching to greenland gl.  I had the same problem, as the game wouldn't start after waiting to be opened in the dock, then quitting without any errors. It got fixed after I extracted the game NOT with the unarchiver utility, BUT WITH the archieve utility.  So, try to extract the deadspace3.zip file with another program.  BTW, the game was AWESOME and thanks noobnak for creating and sharing this wonderful piece with us.  Please keep up the great work.

Well thanks, that actually got it working like a charm! However, I seem to have a fairly major graphics issue, where most of the screen is covered in little horizontal black bars, as well as it still being unpleasantly choppy (though mostly playable) on minimum graphics settings. It seems like it might be my graphics card, but I'm crossing my fingers that it's something that can be resolved easily. I'm running Lion on a 2011 Intel mac, for the record.
